description.narrative: Insatsen är ett multi-sektoriellt program, vars riktade insatser bidrar till att stoppa genderbaserat våld mot kvinnor (GB-VAW). Detta gemensamma program med UNDP, UN Women samt UNFPA täcker alla former av genderbaserat våld mot kvinnor och flickor med särskild tonvikt på våld i hemmet och sexuellt våld, inklusive våldtäkt och trakasserier. Den direkta målgruppen är Ministry of Health and Social Protection, National Council for Gender Equality, 15 kommuner och tjänsteleverantörer (såsom CSO:er). Den indirekt målgruppen är kvinnor som överlevt genderbaserat våld samt allmänheten för offentliga kampanjer. Målsättningen med programmet är att den albanska regeringen och beslutshavare på kommunal nivå säkerställer genomförandet av nationella och internationella åtaganden för att förebygga, upptäcka och skydda medborgare från genderbaserat våld.

The intervention is a multi-sectorial programme whose targeted actions contribute to ending gender based violence against women (GB- VAW). This joint prorgramme of UNDP, UN Women and UNFPA covers all forms of gender based violence against women and girls and specifically addresses domestic violence and sexual violence including rape and harassment. The direct target is the Ministry of Health and Social Protection, National Council for Gender Equality, 15 municipalities and service providers (such as CSOs). The indirect target are women survivors of gender based violence and public for public campaigns. The goal of the programme is that Government of Albania/GoA and municipal duty bearers ensure the implementation of national and international commitments to prevent, detect and protect the citizens against GBV.

The proposed Joint Programme is a multi-sectorial programme whose targeted actions contribute to ending gender based violence against women (GB- VAW). The proposed JP covers all forms of gender based violence against women and girls and specifically addresses domestic violence and sexual violence including rape and harassment. The direct target is the Ministry of Health and Social Protection, National Council for Gender Equality, 15 municipalities and service providers (such as CSOs). The indirect target are women survivors of gender based violence and public for public campaigns. The goal of the programme is that GoA and municipal duty bearers ensure the implementation of national and international commitments to prevent, detect and protect the citizens against GBV. The goal of the programme is: GoA and municipal duty-bearers ensure implementation of international and national legal and political commitments to prevent, detect and protect their citizens against GBV. The three outcomes are: 1) Government bodies guarantee the development of adequate legal and institutional framework needed to prevent, detect and protect the citizens; 2) Targeted municipalities support GB-VAW efforts with funds, human resources coordination in place; 3) Women, girls, men, boys and CSO working on GB-VAW organise collectively to engage in prevention that builds a foundation for social change in eliminating GB-VAW. Some examples of indicative activities are the following: Strengthen the capacities of Coordinated Community Response (CCR); establish new CCRs, support the establishment of emergency and sexual violence centres; use gender responsive budgeting methodology to train local government units to offers services to survivors of GB-VAW, awareness raising campaigns, research with men and boys, etc.

participating-org.narrative: Nordic Consulting Group – NCG Sweden AB

sector.narrative: Ending violence against women and girls

tag.narrative: 5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: During the reporting period (January-December 2020), despite the COVID-19 lockdown and restriction measures, EVAWIA remained focused on its planned activities, but at the same time flexible in its approach to adapt and respond to the new situation. Steady and sustained progress is marked towards achievement of its outcomes and overall goal. Concrete results are achieved mainly focusing on: -Improved sub-legal DV framework tailored as well to COVID-19 pandemic situation: i) two standardized protocols for Coordinated Referral Mechanisms (CRMs) members on managing domestic violence cases in normal situation and in COVID-19 situation were developed and disseminated to all 61 municipalities. ii) adoption and enforcement by MoHSP of the Protocol “On the operation of public and non-public residential centers, providing shelter services to victims of domestic violence and human trafficking during the COVID-19 pandemic”; iii) adoption of policy and procedures against harassment and sexual harassment to protect women and men respectively among armed forces and police forces; iv) approval of three SoPs by MoHSP based on Essential Guidelines of the Multi-sectorial Response for the treatment of DV and GBV cases by health professionals in a normal situation and during civil emergencies, as well as by social care professionals respecting the coordinated multi-sectorial approach as CRM members at the local level and their dissemination in 61 municipalities; v) adoption of the Joint Ministerial Order of the Ministry of Justice (MoJ) and High Council of Justice (HCoJ), on the establishment of a unified DV database generated by courts; vi) approval and enforcement of tailored rules and procedures for management of emergency sexual violence cases in COVID-19 situation in LILIUM Center; -Improved national response to gender equality, gender-based violence and domestic violence through evaluation and preparation of the respective reports on the implementation of key national policies, including NSGE 2016-2020, as well as of the international treaties, such as CEDAW and Istanbul Convention. - Institutional partnerships strengthened among People’s Advocate (PA) and Department of Public Administration (DoPA) to ensure commitment on joint work to prevent and protect employees from all forms of violence harassment and sexual harassment in public administration institutions. - LILIUM Center further strengthened its functioning and providing specialized emergency services to sexual violence victims. A total of 25 cases of sexual violence are supported with specialized integrated support services, out of which 12 cases supported during the COVID-19 lockdown period. - multiple online activities in partnership with CRMs, municipalities, CSOs, local communities, and media raised awareness on GB&DV, challenged gender stereotypes and family power roles with a through a diversity of tools: videos, infographics, art, trainings, social and traditional media, and movies culminating with diverse activities during the 16 Days Campaign of Activism against GBV along with a strong partnership forged with the private sector to promote donations for survivors of violence.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
